docs.text: like a good action film should , " metro " has action that keeps you involved .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some action films have action sequences that are so conventional , our attention is detracted and diverted by other thoughts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " the ghost in the darkness , " which opened a few months ago , is a film that s action was so bland and uninvolving , it not only invited my thoughts to divert me , it nearly put me asleep .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but " metro " is one of the best action films in a while .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is hip , sharp , nifty , and has nice little pieces of suspense and comedy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eddie murphy was in bad shape for a while .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and this invites me to mention last year s " the nutty professor , " which was his blessed revival back to the position at which he used to be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " metro " happens to be a lot better than any film in the " beverly hills cop " series .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that is because " metro " takes itself seriously , but doesn t prevent itself from having a little fun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eddie murphy is at his best in the roles of responsible , and controlled people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the " beverly hills cop " movies all featured eddie as a reckless , wild cop , always crossing the line by just an inch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in " metro " he plays a hostage negotiator , so negotiation is his job , not his hobby or his preferred way out of trouble .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his character in " metro " takes himself seriously .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eddie murphy s mischievous trademark grin is hardly anywhere to be found in " metro , " and perhaps it is quite better off that way .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: murphy plays scott roper , and as i previously mentioned , he is a san francisco hostage negotiator .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the first tense situation in the film , we are introduced to roper s kind of work , as he tries to calm down a confused , unkempt young criminal who has taken captive the entire capacity of the san francisco bank he is holding up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: murphy handles the scene seriously , without his usual happy-go-lucky , misfit humor .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film develops when its villain is established , and the villain here is the beguiling michael korda , a jewel thief , and murderer who likes to let cops know of his hostage fatalities by giving them the ear of the victim .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " metro " takes different twists and slight turns , and there is one great , virtuoso chase scene , involving the a cable car .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cars flip .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cars crash .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cars turn over .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and it is done so good in this film , i was reminded of " speed , " and the speeding bus that couldn t go under fifty mile per hour for very significant reasons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are also some other good scenes in " metro " that a lot of films would rather choose not to have .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: scenes like the one with roper and his new partner are at the horse track roper is a gambler who knows all the tricks and roper teaches his partner a few little methods of betting and winning .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , the writers tried to disguise the scene as being insignificant by having roper draw parallels between hostage negotiation and gambling .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the scenes between roper and his girlfriend are nice , too .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: those are the scenes that make up " metro , " which is mainly about eddie murphy s maturing as a personality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actor that i most enjoyed seeing in " metro " was michael rapaport , who plays roper s new partner , a lip-reading , book-skimming genius , and a master of observation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it was not the actor s presence that pleased me as much as the role he was cast in the role of a proclaimed genius .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rapaport is an actor who i usually see in the role of the dimwit the really , really dopey dimwit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i hardly recognized him in " metro , " and it was quite a joy to be able to see him in a role like this i feel that i respect him more .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are two main types of villains in movies like this : the ones that are part of the story , and the ones that are devices .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the villain in " metro " is no more than a device , but he is a darn good villain nonetheless .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is played by michael wincott , whose voice is pushed out in a abraded rasp , as if he smokes a cigarette between every take .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wincott makes his villain , korda , as mean as could be , the classic type of villain who would push an old lady down a flight of stairs just for kicks , like richard widmark in " kiss of death . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and , in addition , wincott s physical appearance and mannerisms , in the film , actually reminded my of an arrogant friend i use to have , who is no longer on my good list .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i liked " metro , " and i do not think would have worked with any other actor but eddie murphy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his past roles were the great ones but they were also a precursor to the maturing that would later take place , possibly from murphy s growing as a person , now having a family .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " metro " is a no-nonsense movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it works as a buddy movie , which it does not overplay .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it works as a dry comedy , which it does not overplay .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it works as a suspense film , which it does not overplay .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and it works as an action film , where it does have a tendency to occasionally go all-out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but who cares ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it still remains serious , and it does not overdo itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh , and there were plenty of explosions in " metro , " as well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how nice it was of the filmmakers to give us those .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if there is one major objection i had to " metro " , it was the length , an area where a lot of action films seem to wear out their welcomes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " metro " is a film that lasted a little too long , but it was still entertaining , and it gave me something to do while i waited for it to end .
docs.label: negative
